mods.abstract: $20 Reward. RANAWAY from the Plantation of Mrs. Mary Scudder, on Sunday nigh, Jan. 2d. 1853, the negro man FRANK, about 5 feet high, dark griffe, small, slender, quick in his movements, converses fluently, and has a slight scar on his right cheek, caused by a burn. He is either lurking about Baton Rouge or will attempt to make his way to Mississippi. -- Ten dollars reward will be given for his apprehension, if caught in the Parish, or twenty if out of it. Also negro man Abram, dark griffe, middle height, stout thick, and has a scar on the right or left cheek caused by a hurn, intelligent but slovenly in his appearance, same reward as the other. G.M. PEIRCE, For Mrs. Mary C. Scudder.
